programme.title: Legend FC #7
programme.desc: Legend Fighting Championship (Legend) was the Asia-Pacific championship of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). Legend invited national champion MMA fighters from throughout the Asia-Pacific region to compete in a freestyle tournament using interdisciplinary martial arts skills in supervised matches under a strict set of rules designed to promote athlete safety and sportsmanship. Legend was committed to promoting the sport of MMA throughout the region, to supporting and cultivating its athletes, and to providing exceptional entertainment to a broad audience.

programme.title: Legend FC #4
programme.desc: Legend Fighting Championship (Legend) was the Asia-Pacific championship of Mixed Martial Arts (MMA). Legend invited national champion MMA fighters from throughout the Asia-Pacific region to compete in a freestyle tournament using interdisciplinary martial arts skills in supervised matches under a strict set of rules designed to promote athlete safety and sportsmanship. Legend was committed to promoting the sport of MMA throughout the region, to supporting and cultivating its athletes, and to providing exceptional entertainment to a broad audience.

programme.title: Ismay Urged More Speed
programme.desc: How involved was Bruce Ismay with the operation of White Star ships at sea? Did he really urge Captain Smith to ignore ice warnings? Senan’s uncovered an account from the Oceanic that suggests Ismay overrode the command of at least one Captain in a...

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero!

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: How Did Titanic Sink?
programme.desc: He’s visited the wreck more than 30 times in the last 25 years. P.H. Nargeolet gives us his personal observations about the wreck and how Titanic might have gone down.

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism?

programme.title: Submarine Signals
programme.desc: In 1912, the greatest threat to shipping was not ice - it was fog. Bill Sauder explains how submarine signaling helped navigate ships like Titanic through treacherous waters.

programme.title: How the Wreck Has Changed
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host and famed Titanic Explorer P.H. Nargeolet takes us back down to the wreck for a look at Titanic’s changing conditions and deterioration.

programme.title: Should Titanic Have Turned into the Iceberg?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson takes on the popular controversy that instead of trying to avoid the iceberg, maybe Titanic should have just turned directly into it? Could this have really saved Titanic?

programme.title: Another View on the Coal Burning Fire
programme.desc: A recent documentary presented new theories about the coal burning fire onboard Titanic. Parks Stephenson gives his view of the fire and how it affected Titanic. Senan Molony and Parks Stephenson, two of our hosts, are on Titanic’s center stage!

programme.title: Please No Smoking But If You Must
programme.desc: In 1912 people knew that smoking was bad for your health. Titanic had designated nonsmoking areas around the ship but if you needed to light-up, the smoking lounges were waiting. Bill Sauder tells us there was more than just smoking going on inside.

programme.title: The Story Behind Titanic's Real Time Sinking
programme.desc: Tom Lynskey and Matt DeWinkeleer take us behind the scenes of their amazingly popular 2 hour 40 minute Titanic Sinks in REAL TIME. With over 17,670,154 views, it definitely captured the world’s attention.

programme.title: The Anchor Crane Mystery - Ken Marschall
programme.desc: When the first images of Titanic came back in 1985, everyone noticed how the bow anchor crane was turned to a very unusual position; even considering the crash into the ocean floor. Jim Cameron’s got one theory about what happened and Ken Marschall’s...

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: The Coal Burning Fire Photo
programme.desc: At the center of the new coal burning fire documentary, is the photograph that seems to show a 60 ft black mark along the side of Titanic’s hull. Famed artist, Ken Marschall, gives us his view of the photograph and the black mark.

programme.title: Titanic's Press Photography
programme.desc: White Star was known for its strong marketing efforts and innovative sales tactics. Titanic interior expert Daniel Klistorner, explains why the photographs taken by the press were so important then and still are today.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: What's in a Name?
programme.desc: Why was it so important for White Star to make sure Titanic was named RMS Titanic instead of just SS Titanic?

programme.title: Uncommon Courtesy
programme.desc: Many believe the Edwardian society was a rigid system of empty gestures and rituals and was just too restrictive in the lives of people. Well, the Edwardians didn’t quite see it that way. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder takes a fascinating look at how...

programme.title: La Grande Odyssée 2024 - Best Of
programme.desc: The Grande Odyssée VVF has been, since its first edition in January 2005, the annual sled dog event in Europe. It is the most demanding stage race in a unique alpine setting in the world. This year 2024, an exceptional sporting field is brought together with more than 65 international mushers and their 600 very high-level dog-athletes who will compete over nearly 400km and 12,000m of cumulative positive altitude difference, in the superb landscapes of the French region Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes.

programme.title: Nightmare Climbs - Stentaria (Eng)
programme.desc: Our two heroes Emiliano Cantagallo and Patrick Martini go through the door of hell climbing 1011 meters on La Stentaria with an average gradient of 19 which gets worse until reaching the maximum of 32 before finally climbing the hill. We are in Friuli - on the opposite side of the Zoncolan up the pass of the saddle. Seeing is believing......

programme.title: Ungrounded Episode 1 - Caroline Gleich
programme.desc: Caroline Gleich, a world class ski mountaineer, summited Mt. Everest last spring as part of her #ClimbForEquality campaign to raise awareness for gender equality. In Episode 1, Gleich overcomes her own struggle after tearing her ACL to rise to the top for all women. (English version with French, Italian, German and Spanish subtitles available)

programme.title: Laax Open 2024
programme.desc: The LAAX OPEN is Europes most important snowboard event: Since 2005, the January OPEN event in LAAX, Switzerland, has been a living freestyle lifestyle, melding contest with culture. Since 2017, it has been part of the FIS Snowboard World Cup circuit and is considered by numerous riders and teams there as the top favourite event. Performances in slopestyle and superpipe are all set to take the centre stage during the FIS Snowboard & Freeski World Cup. Women, men, on snowboards and freeskis will be soaring high and hurrahing the finest freestyle action.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #2
programme.desc: Les coureurs ont pu profiter de la ferveur populaire des habitants du village d’Arêches, au départ de cette2e étape, pour faire le plein d’énergie. Cette communion avec le public beaufortain faisait figure de prologue à une étape décrite par les participants comme la plus difficile vécue avec ses 5 cols, 31 km, 3350 m de D+ et 3165 m deD-. Les chutes de neige de la nuit encore actives le matin ont largement contribué à alourdir l’effort malgré un énorme travail des bénévoles pour entretenir la trace.

programme.title: Pierra Menta 2025 #4
programme.desc: Axelle Gachet-Mollaret et Lorna Bonnel remportent cette 39e édition de la Pierra Menta avec classe. Chez les hommes, Xavier Gachet etWilliam Bon Mardion simposent et réalisent un doublé historique 10 jours après leur titre de champion du monde par équipe

programme.title: Trail Menorca Cami De Cavalls 2024
programme.desc: Can you imagine waking up, preparing your backpack, putting on your trainers and running 185 km around the Island of Menorca, with a cumulative elevation gain of 3,500 metres? This is the what awaits you in the Trail Menorca Camí de Cavalls, one of the longest Trail races in Europe and one of the most attractive challenges you can face today. If you prefer you can run shorter distances as there are 5 other races (27, 45, 58, 85 and 100 km)

programme.title: Sardinia Trail 2025
programme.desc: Athletes from 15 different countries compete in this 3-stage trail running event covering 100 km and 4000 m of elevation gain. The stunning routes of the Sardinia Trail are a magnet for trail running enthusiasts, highlighting the fusion of sea and mountain, nature and history, through unspoiled and mysterious landscapes. Des athlètes de 15 pays différents saffrontent lors de cette épreuve de trail en trois étapes, couvrant 100 km et 4 000 m de dénivelé positif. Les parcours époustouflants du Sardinia Trail attirent les amateurs de trail, mettant en valeur la fusion entre mer et montagne, nature et histoire, à travers des paysages préservés et mystérieux.Atleti provenienti da 15 nazioni diverse si sfidano in questa gara di trail running in tre tappe, che copre un percorso di 100 km e 4000 m di dislivello. Gli splendidi percorsi del Sardinia Trail sono una vera e propria calamita per gli appassionati di trail running, esaltando la fusione tra mare e montagna, natura e storia, attraverso paesaggi incontaminati e misteriosi.

programme.title: Golden Trail World Series 2024 Race Recaps - Episode 4 Sierre Zinal & Tatra Sky Marathon (Eng)
programme.desc: The long-standing Sierre-Zinal in Switzerland is the fifth race of the season and is included in the European trip along with the sixth race, the Tatra Sky Marathon in Poland. The route from Sierre to Zinal is called "La Course des cinq 4 000" because along the route runners can admire views of 5 peaks over 4 000 m high. A first time race in Poland, the Tatra Sky Marathon is held on the Polish side of the Tatras in Kościelisko one week after Sierre Zinal.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams Season 2022 - Episode 4 The Gin and The Tonic (Eng)
programme.desc: After last year’s extraordinary appearance on the Golden Trail Series, Nienke Brinkman is back. She will try to combine road running and trail running in one season. But is it too ambitious? See how Joyce Njeru, the new Kenyan prodigy from Team Run2gether, is determined to perform at her best in Sierre-Zinal.

programme.title: Taylor Spivey: Riding the waves | Triathlon Racing Short
programme.desc: Follow Taylor Spiveys 2022 Super League Triathlon Championship series from beginning to end in our latest racing short episode, Taylor Spivey: Riding the waves.

programme.title: Golden Trail Series - Chasing Dreams 2023 - Ep 1 Redemption (Eng)
programme.desc: The season kicks off in the Basque Country with Rémi Bonnet aiming to maintain his champion status and Manuel Merillas chasing his seven-year dream, bringing back last season’s rivalry to Zegama’s challenging trails.

programme.title: Transvulcania 2024
programme.desc: La Palma, the northernmost of the 8 Canary Islands welcomes since 2009 The Transvulcania Adidas Terrex Ultra Marathon. 2800 runners from all over the world compete in one of the four races, Half marathon, marathon, ultra marathon and vertical Km.

programme.title: Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon 2024
programme.desc: The Standard Chartered Singapore Marathon 2024 takes us inside Southeast Asias only World Athletics Gold Label race, capturing the drama, determination, and triumph of elite and recreational runners. With 55,000 participants, we see the intense battles in the Elite and National Championship races, following top contenders like Geoffrey Yegon and Zewude Jifar. Beyond the competition, it highlights inspiring stories like Dr. William Tans incredible journey.

programme.title: Bimax Alchimia 28 2023 - Ultimate efficiency
programme.desc: On-board testing on Bimax Alchimia 28 in hybrid propulsion with the maximum result of performance and energy efficiency.

programme.title: It all begins with a dream
programme.desc: Selva Marine is an Italian company located in the middle of the Alps, in Valtellina.It all began when, one Sunday in the 1950s, the Selva family decided to go to Milan for the powerboat race. For Lorenzo Selva it was the beginning of a dream that he would soon turn into reality.

programme.title: MarineMax - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese is at the MIBS to discover all about MarineMax, one of the key players in the boating and marine industry.

programme.title: Yanmar Venmar Lido 32 - Sustainable Navigation
programme.desc: Follow Maurizio Bulleri testing the future of green mobility with the Venmar Lido 32, the latest generation Yanmar Diesel powered boat, powered by HVO, 100 organic Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil.

programme.title: Arcadia A96 - Interview with Francesco Ansalone
programme.desc: The Boat Show studio opens its doors to Francesco Ansalone, Chief Marketing Officer of Arcadia Yachts, who will introduce the new Arcadia A96.

programme.title: Schaefer 660 - MIBS 2023
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Miami International Boat Show on board Schaefer 660.

programme.title: Rosetti Superyachts 38M - A strong DNA
programme.desc: Rosetti Superyachts was born from the Rosetti Marine shipyard. In the DNA lies the strength of industrial boats, which are subjected to extreme conditions. The new Rosetti 38 Explorer moves in this direction, with a steel hull and great autonomy.

programme.title: Azimuth S7 - Boot 2023
programme.desc: Climb aboard the Azimut S7, a boat that with its sober elegance wants to offer a marine environment, supported by advanced technologies and high quality design.

programme.title: CLX96 – A yacht that cuts through the water
programme.desc: The CLX96 belongs to the CLX series, a brand-new line by CL Yachts. This yacht cuts through the water thanks to the planing hulls hydrodynamic efficiency. What an incredible performance.

programme.title: A new point of reference
programme.desc: Discover a yacht that is different from the ones in the same category and that offers an intense interaction with the sea. With its luxurious style and magnificent interior and exterior spaces, the Bluegame BGX 70 is destined to be a point of reference for other boats.

programme.title: Prestige X60 - X-Line Flying Bridge Yacht (Eng)
programme.desc: Hop on board the Prestige X60, an incredible superyacht on which to spend unforgettable days, surrounded by music, fun and relaxation.

programme.title: A special super yacht
programme.desc: This Benetti Fast Lejos 125 is one of the leading boats in the mega-yacht market, thanks to its excellent performance. Take look at the propulsion system is by Rolls Royce… but it is not over! Keep watching and check out the performance…

programme.title: Pure fascination
programme.desc: Discover the Wally Better Place, 50 meters of pure fascination, with a great hull, designed by Bill Tripp. This incredible sailboat is the biggest sloop made of carbon ever built. The exterior is very innovative and so is the interior, with its very impressive spaces.

programme.title: Sanlorenzo SP110 - FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: Displayed at the Fort Lauderdale’s Boat Show was the Sanlorenzo SP110. This model belongs to a new series that embodies the concept of lightness and also a new approach to design.

programme.title: Cranchi 67 - Habitable solutions
programme.desc: With its 150 years of history, Cranchi boasts a glorious past and a promising present, and will make you dream with its new image. Come and discover the Cranchi 67, a yacht that offers habitability and furnishing solutions, typical of larger boats.

programme.title: Mangusta Oceano 44 – Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Mangusta Oceano 44 is a masterpiece of elegance and innovation. Built in Italy by Overmarine, this three-deck superyacht stands out for its cutting-edge design, spacious interiors and extraordinary performance, redefining the concept of luxury on the open sea.

programme.title: Amer 120 - A relaxing journey
programme.desc: Come and discover an amazing superyacht! It is the largest yacht built to date with the IPS volvo penta propulsion. It has been designed according to the owners wishes, and the use of fibreglass has been significantly reduced in favour of easily recycled materials such as metal and glass.

programme.title: Evergreen charm
programme.desc: The Magnum 70 Pegasus has lots of special features onboard and is a racing boat that is once of a kind. Built 15 years ago, this boat exudes an evergreen charm. As velocity is key for this boat, almost everything on board has been changed to make sure it resulted as light as it possibly can, even the closets are made of fabric.

programme.title: Tankoa Solo - A nautical masterpiece
programme.desc: The Boat Show offers you a special seat to discover magnificent vessels, inside and out. That’s the turn of the Tankoa Solo, a superyacht with a long story and was built with the only goal to be perfect in every way. Discover all the work behind this Italian masterpiece.

programme.title: Absolute 52 Fly - A fascinating superyacht
programme.desc: Launched in 2012, the Absolute 52 Fly, has now been restyled! So easy to pilot, this model will surely continue to be one of the best selling boats from Absolute Yachts.

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Worldwide premier of the Pearl 72, discover this incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Riva 82 Diva – It is indeed a ‘Diva’
programme.desc: The Riva 82’ Diva, a yacht built in Italy by world iconic shipyard Riva, flaunts its advanced new design and super structure with an attitude. It is a boat that fits perfectly with its name, a ‘Diva’.

programme.title: Goal Setting
programme.desc: Welcome to the Sportskool philosophy and how to achieve your fitness goals.

programme.title: Golf Training 03
programme.desc: Consistent play equals lower scores. Mark Verstegen gets you ready for a 36 hole day.

programme.desc: Power up for everyday life with this top-notch resistance training.

programme.title: Baby Workout
programme.desc: Incorporate your child in your daily workout.

programme.title: Who Can I Run To?
programme.desc: Monica is the former lead singer of the three-girl group "Illicit" who were once an R&B powerhouse. She went on to have a less than stellar solo career but now feels there is something missing. When she reunites with her former group members, they try to show her that God is the answer to her plaguing questions and also the power in gospel music. Monica, on the verge of ending a loveless relationship, must decide if she is ready for the upheaval that her girlfriends suggest. The movie soars with love, gospel music and redemption.

programme.title: In The Hive
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Xtra Keys hopes to raise his son better than his boozy, razor-edged mother raised him, and he just might get his wish when hes thrust into an unorthodox alternative school full of underprivileged boys.

programme.title: Im No Gangster
programme.desc: The Crew find out about Heather and Anthony’s trouble as they meet with their new drug connection. Things get heated in a meeting between Nicky and Jackie. Johnny struggles to keep the group together

programme.title: Crew: Season 1 Finale
programme.desc: Willie strikes back at Nicky, Hector visits with Mark and Heather to discuss terms. Anthony has trouble on the road with Heather

programme.title: The Passing
programme.desc: Three siblings inherit an estate from their grandmother. The mansion has passed from grandmother to granddaughter for centuries, and grandma has a long reach from the grave to assure the line is not unbroken. The three teens have a weekend party with...

programme.title: Devils Brigade Episode 2
programme.desc: Episode 2 of this unique PBS series Modern Special Forces troops from both the United States military and the Canadian Armed Forces have been brought together to train using the same methods and equipment as the First Special Service Force in the 1940s.

programme.title: Homeskillet
programme.desc: A powerful drama about a women awakens to the plight of homeless and goes on a protest fast that changes the lives of everyone around her. Played on PBS stations nationwide

programme.title: Lost and Found Music Studios
programme.desc: S1:E10 John and Luke visit their old piano teacher and receive unexpected news. Jude helps Eva get over her diary disaster by arranging a recording session. Leia and Maggie unexpectedly wind up at a concert together.

programme.title: The Enid Blyton Adventure Series
programme.desc: Book 5: The Mountain of Adventure: Part 3. After attempting to rescue Philip from the Mountain, the children try to escape and discover the anti-gravity cavern.

programme.title: Radio Active
programme.desc: S2:E24 Ms. Atoll begins teaching the most boring class ever, causing each student daydreams.

programme.title: Fries With That?

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 11
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: Eng 9 From Brush to Structure Fires
programme.desc: We meet the crew from Engine 9 with Captain Karey Wedemeyer on the B" shift. The morning starts off with them getting new SCBAs, then, they catch a EMS run. Back at the Station, since its the Captains Birthday, everyone, including the cameraman, have to workout to one of Kareys workout DVDs,. The Captain is quite the animal lover, she actually works for a Pit Bull shelter in Fresno. 4:00AM, a call comes in. Its a structure fire, at this fire the Captain meets up with her husband, a Captain on Engine 3s "B" Shift. Once again, youll see Captain Durney, he may be close to retirement, but that does not stop him from doing all he can, all of the time.

programme.title: Engines 3 and 9
programme.desc: We finish up a 24 hour shift with the crew from Engine 9 who finish with a morning structure fire. The next 24 hours back at Station 9 with firefighter Robert Castillion, he just made Captain at the busiest station in Fresno, Station 3. Garcia is the Engineer. A call comes in, its a rubbish fire. Its Night, we are back at Station 9, to find the crew in the engine bay doing todays exercise. Then, the call comes in, with both engine companies responding. Engine 3 is on-scene with Truck 4 when Engine 9 arrives. Tonight they are testing out some Key Combat Ready Hose line, it pulls out great; they are in on this mattress wherehouse fire for a little while.

programme.title: First 24 with Engine 3
programme.desc: Night - Engine 3s Crew gets a few calls. A call comes in for a commercial structure fire, its a guy whos a hoarder. Sparks fly as they gain entry on A, B and D sides. It takes the Fire Crew all night to fight the fire.

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 1
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: 48 hours with Captain Durney
programme.desc: This is 48 Hours is with Capt. Oney Durney at Station 13. This firefigher has been with the department for so many years, they are not really sure as to how old he is. Hes nearing his retirement and trying to get as much time on the job that he loves so much before he has to retire. Take in mind, this guys is on both the USAR and Water Rescue team, we find him on Trucks and Engines, and hes still trys to be first-in. When you see him complete his Wildland Fire Training with his crew, its over 100 degrees, hes in his yellows, shovel or rake in hand, and he is out there heading up his crew. During the sit-down training sessions, hes gaining every bit of knowledge they are teaching today, to us, this guys a true Gladitor in the fire service.In this webisode, some of his brothers and sisters in the fire service give him a shout out.

programme.title: "This is insane" Supercar Blondie's F1 crash course
programme.desc: Euronews Evan Bourke joins social media star, Supercar Blondie , to test drive an F1 racing car in Dubai. Shes become a social media sensation for testing out some of the worlds most beautiful cars, so what better way to meet Supercar Blondie , than to propose a test drive in the ultimate racing machine - an F1 race car. Euronews Dubai based correspondent Evan Bourke was given the breathtakingly gruesome job -honestly, his colleagues are not jealous - of having to take part in the test drive at the Dubai Autodome . The race track is one of the few places in the world where it is possible to get in an F1 car and experience the adrenaline rush that 6G and more than 500 horsepower has to offer. Supercarblondie has six million Instagram followers and is known for her love of Supercars but even this was a first for her. To watch the full episode of Adventures, click on the video link above.

programme.title: Wuzhen
programme.desc: Come visit Wuzhen, a 1,300-year-old water town on the lower reaches of the Yangtze River. Located on the Hangzhou-Jiaxing-Huzhou Plain in northern Zhejiang Province, it isat the center of the golden triangle consisting of Shanghai, Hangzhou and Suzhou. The most famous of the six “watertowns” in China, Wuzhen is commonly called “the Venice of the East” so taking a boat ride through the towns storied canals is a must. If you are going to make a day out of it, we recommend exploring the East section during the day and visiting the West section after 5p when the tourist crowds die down.

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: La Mer: Dubai's bohemian beachfront
programme.desc: Postcards heads down to La Mer, Dubais newest beachfront development to check out the vintage-style beach huts, water sports, restaurants, bars, fashion stores and street art. A magnet for Instagrammers, La Mer is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside destinations. The street art here talks to its audience. Visitors can hire a sunbed or rent a whole day room on the sand, and the multi-coloured beach huts house showers. And, if you fancy an ice cream, youll find some interesting flavours. "Here at iScream , we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, ketchup, Mexican chilli-chocolate and you name it," says iSreams Managing Partner, Rami Halawi. ​At the confluence of north and south La Mer, you’ll find Laguna Water Park . Here you can test your courage on slides knotted with surprise twists and turns, or learn to surf on the 180-degree wave machine by Flowrider. For more wet and wild adventures, head to the beach – there are two water sports centres with a huge range of activities. Its also possible to explore the coast on a guided jet ski tour. Those who prefer airborne adventures can bounce around at Hawa Hawa , the weird and wavy trampoline-like playground imported from Japan. For those who just want to relax and chill out, dont worry, theres still plenty to do. Before day slips into night, secure a seat with sunset views at one of La Mer’s beautiful beachfront eateries. Masti is known for its mixology and its modern Indian cuisine. ​ If thats not enough, La Mer has a vintage-style cinema, fabulous street performers and seasonal celebrations to keep visitors entertained all night long. ​

programme.title: Visiting Dubai's many museums
programme.desc: Dubai is home to a multitude of museums, from world-firsts to hidden gems. Quranic Park is one of the citys brand new attractions. About the size of 60 rugby fields, it has been created to give visitors some green space and a better understanding of Islamic beliefs. Inside the park’s orchards and Glass House, visitors can discover a variety of healthy and medicinal flora featured in the Holy Quran, from pomegranates and olives, to figs and garlic. Another attraction at Quranic Park is the Cave of Miracles, where seven miracles recounted in the Holy Quran play out on the walls. "The cave was amazing," says Usman, who is visiting from the UK. "We learnt a lot about the miracles growing up, it just gave another understanding to it. And it was great to visualise it, not just hear about it." "This is an open example that the Quran is not just to read in order to get reward but it is something that can be in practical life," says Anwar, a visitor from the US. "This place is beautiful and a very interesting experience for children. Here, they can actually experience things from the Quran," says Miteab, who lives in Saudi Arabia. Al Shindagha Perfume House From aromatic flora to the UAE’s first museum dedicated to fragrance. The Al Shindagha museum is home to the Perfume House . Part of a complex created to gather, preserve and share Emirati heritage, Perfume House charts the history and role of fragrance in the region. Rashed Almuhairi is Perfume House’s Chief Cultural Guide. “It’s special and important not only for the guests who are coming, he tells Euronews. "It’s for our own generations also. A lot of our youth, they didn’t live in many things like perfuming or pearl diving, so it’s important that they know about our past life. Dubai has a very rich history which needs to be told.” One of the more unusual exhibits on display is a 28 kilogramme piece of oud. Oud is formed in aquilaria trees when they are infected with a particular type of mould. This resinous heartwood is the key ingr

programme.title: The Mystical town of San Sebastian del Oeste, Mexio
programme.desc: Teri travels to San Sebastian del Oeste, an hour outside of Puerto Vallarta to experience the old mining town covered with pine, coffee and avocado trees. Here she learns the origin of the avocado, called aguacate (in Spanish) that was taken from the Nahuatl word of Āhuacatl (native Aztec language) which means "testicle tree".

programme.title: Tokyo
programme.desc: When you look out your taxi window here, you see life in High-Definition (HD). Tokyo glistens and glows with precision and truly stands in a class of her own. Every street, alley, and crevice lends itself as a gateway to adventures with endless possibilities. A city rooted in heavy history and tradition, but propelled by innovation and imagination, Tokyo has a spellbinding flare for artisan culture, creativity, and design. There is no place like it on Earth, and being home to more Michelin stars than any other place in the world is merely a symbol of Tokyoites devotion to craftsmanship and inventiveness. This city is an endless feast of inspiration - exploring the unknown and finding new paths is highly recommended. Remember to stay humble and behave respectfully, because good manners and thoughtfulness are the real ways to truly experiencing Tokyo and making a few fabulous friends along the way.

programme.title: Balloon trip gives passengers a real bird’s eye view of the desert
programme.desc: Ballooning is the earliest form of human flight. In 18th century France, King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette watched as the first passengers - a duck, a rooster and a sheep - took off in one from Versailles . These days it’s a big attraction for tourists the world over. But in Dubai, hot air ballooning comes with a twist. You can fly with a peregrine falcon. Falconer Dylan Freeman says its the only place in the world where you can fly with the fastest animal on the planet. “What were trying to simulate here is having the falcon soaring. “Theyve been recorded reaching speeds of 389 km/h in a dive. From one kilometre up he can see a pigeon four kilometres away. So then he would fly above it, fold up his wings, and dive down really quickly to try and catch it.” Peter Kollar, co-founder and chief pilot of Balloon Adventures Dubai , says dawn is a good time to take to the skies. “Its a beautiful area because its a mix of desert, pristine desert …… and there are green oases in the desert, which gives a beautiful contrast.” Kollar says the route the balloon takes is very much up to the weather. “Eighty per cent of my work is meteorology. If we get the weather right my job is relatively simple. Really ballooning is true flying because you have to use Mother Nature.”

programme.title: What to do in Pompano Beach
programme.desc: One of South Florida’s hidden gems is Pompano Beach, Florida. Located just north of Fort Lauderdale, this quiet beach town is perfect for those who prefer less crowds and a laid back atmosphere. It’s ideal location makes access to other South Florida towns, including Miami, super easy. I start my journey at the Fort Lauderdale Marriott Pompano Beach Resort & Spa. It has the most amazing sunrises which I delighted in each day from my private balcony. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it very difficult to leave. I visit the charming beachside town of Lauderdale by the Sea, a 10 minute drive from my hotel. I also take a tour at Butterfly World, the first and largest butterfly house in the United States. It is home over 80 species of butterflies, hummingbird and lorikeet aviaries, and outdoor gardens. This place is truly magical for people of all ages. Pompano Beach is the quintessential beach town. You can truly relax and enjoy the beach at your own pace while indulging as much or as little as you’d like.

programme.title: Did you know Dubai is fifth most instagrammed city in the world?
programme.desc: Dubai has been named the 5th most Instagrammed city in the world in a survey by travel site Wego. From its sweeping beaches, to standout architecture and world class restaurants, there’s a photo opportunity to be found at every landmark and for every occasion. In fact, food is one of the main reasons for visiting the city. Dubai led the way in the food category for Instagram hashtags with a massive 26 per cent of all hashtags in or including Dubai also including food. This summer alone there were 79 million hashtags related to Dubai. Some of the hotspots include the city’s Miracle Garden which is the largest flower garden in the world. It has 72,000 square metres with over 50 million blooming flowers. As well as the Miracle Garden, downtown Dubai is also home to the Burj Khalifa which is also one of the top five most instagrammed places in the city. And in the city’s centrally located Zabeel Park you can find Dubai Frame, an architectural landmark. This 150-metre-high, 93-metre-wide structure is positioned so that visitors can soak in the views of modern Dubai to the south and old Dubai to the north. Mamoun Hmedan, Managing Director, MENA and India, Wego says the ranking is a huge achievement for Dubai. “Dubai is the one and only Arab city that’s ranked within the top five. That’s a lot for one city compared to very well-established tourism destinations,” he says. The top city in terms of hashtags was London with 118 million posts. Next was Paris with 101 million, followed by Nice and New York who received 87 million and 83 million respectively. Other top hashtags include Istanbul, Jakarta, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Moscow, and Tokyo. Sarah Hedley Hymers is a travel journalist and social media influencer. She says putting photos on Instagram is all about social capital. “You want to present something that is aspirational," she explains. "It has to be well-framed. It has to be colourful – dark pictures don’t do so well on Instagram. So, you’re looking for something that is bright, that real

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: Things to do in Al Quoz, Dubai’s art hub, home to Alserkal Avenue, artisan cafes and classic cars
programme.desc: Once just an overlooked industrial estate hidden behind the high-rises of Dubai’s Sheikh Zayed Road, Al Quoz is now the beating heart of the citys art scene. Home to Alserkal Avenue – actually a block of streets lined with some of the best art galleries in Dubai – Al Quoz is full of surprises. There’s more than world-class art hidden behind Al Quozs vast landscape of warehouses; where theres art, theres life, after all – and life here is vibrant. Just about every enterprise in Al Quoz comes with an exciting twist; for example, Al Quoz restaurant and speciality coffee bar Café Rider doubles as a custom motorbike store. Mirzam , meanwhile, is an artisan chocolate factory thats also a café, located in the neighbourhood’s central art hub, Alserkal Avenue . Alserkal Avenue cafes are defined by their fair-trade principles and creative concoctions that echo the area’s artistic character. From golden turmeric lattes to immune-boosting vegan matcha bowls, menus are bursting with goodness. Things to do in Alserkal Avenue and neighbouring complex, The Courtyard, include inspiring workshops; there are several to choose between. At Oo La Lab , a fragrance mixology studio in Alserkal Avenue, you can learn how to create your own signature cologne. Or, just across the road, you can join an art class in Dubai’s popular community art space thejamjar . Going strong for 15 years, thejamjar is a regular host of Alserkal Avenue events and art lessons, teaches budding artists of all ages several disciplines, from painting with oils to acrylic techniques. Tilika D’Souza, an art instructor at thejamjar, says the wellbeing of the participants is also important to the foundation: "We have a workshop called Intuitive Creativity that combines meditation and art; we use all kinds of different art materials and we do a little meditation to begin with, so everybody is really relaxed during and after the class." programme.title: Mrs. Pound
programme.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover, this is not your average stamp shop. Inspired by a fictional story of secret lovers, Mrs. Pound brings to life the story of a former 1950s Shanghai burlesque dancer, her married lover (Mr. Ming) and their elaborate clandestine rendezvous space. Offering a new twist on asian fusion cuisine, the 45 seat venue features a lower dining room (Mrs. Pound), an upper dining room (Mr . Ming), and a bar area at which these two spaces merge. Mixed with plush velvet banquettes, vintage tiles, neon artwork, suspended mirrored marquee lights with lipstick messages, and a 1960s style showgirl glamour, Mrs. Pounds creative interior sets the tone for a unique and entertaining culinary (and drinking) experience. We like the Hainanese Chicken Rice, Thai Milk Tea Cake, Sriracha Street Corn, and Lemongrass Pork Chop. Although it will be a longer wait, do yourself a favor and go for dinner for the best experience.

programme.title: Keeping tradition alive in Dubai
programme.desc: Tradition isnt exactly what first comes to mind when one thinks of Dubai, a city that quite literally grew out of the desert, but tourists are flocking to the Middle Eastern oasis for a taste of its Bedouin past. Camel races Old meets new can be seen at Dubais Camel Racing Club where these ships of the desert sprint across the perimeter of the famed Al Mamoom racetrack. Attracting both camel owners and punters alike, spectators can sit in their cars and drive alongside the camels as they hurtle towards the finish line, guided by a remote control jockey. Organisers say the event is a draw for tourists for a number of reasons. “When tourists come to the camel racing venues, they see something new. They see how people treat the camels and how the camels compete with each other. They also see how Emirati society promotes camels, says the clubs CEO and General Amanager Ali Saeed Bin Saroud. Camel racing was promoted by the former UAE president, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan as a way of bringing camels and back into mainstream Dubai culture. The Dubai Royal Family also actively support camel racing as a way of preserving the traditional Bedouin culture. Desert culture The Al Marmoom Heritage Festival is Dubai’s annual celebration of the traditional Arabian desert culture and vital role which it plays in the cultural identity of its people. Traditional markets, music and dancing are another way in which the Bedouin culture is kept alive and enjoyed by Dubai locals and tourists alike. Arabic hospitality German expat Ursula Musch moved to Dubai around 20 years ago after first visiting in 1993. She now breeds camels and encourages tourists to experience the Bedouin customs for themselves, as they, like her, may just find their passion in life. My passion or my message is I want to give foreigners, other people the chance to know something from the Arabic hospitality, from their tradition, from their culture, to show it to give it to other people who don’t

programme.title: Sak Yant Tattoo
programme.desc: Traditional hand needle tattoos have been a staple of Thai culture for centuries with the common practitioners being Buddhist monks. Why? The spiritual significance and meanings behind the permanent body art are manifestations of the individual’s aura. Ajarn Noo, a former Buddhist monk turned spiritual Thai tattoo master, has gained international recognition since tattooing Angelina Jolie and consequently many other celebrities like Michele Rodriguez and David Beckham. His tattoo parlor is unlike any you’ve ever been to because he performs the spiritual practice in the sanctuary of his own home. Walk past the larger than life statues devoted to Buddha, up the stairs and into the top floor of his residence There you will find photos adorning his walls of countless celebrities, the royal family and others who have come before you. You can than evaluate your various options but here is the kicker – there is no guarantee you will get the tattoo you are looking for. You must first stand before Ajarn Noo for a spiritual evaluation and based on each individual’s aura, Ajarn Noo will either approve and customize a tattoo for you based on your own spirit or send you packing. So come with a clear heart, a clear mind and let your inner soul speak to Ajarn in hopes of a tattoo blessing that will be unlike any other.

programme.title: From screen to plate: the MasterChef restaurant goes live
programme.desc: Its the most successful cookery television format in the world having been adapted in 52 countries and viewed by over 250 million people worldwide. Now the MasterChef TV Experience is going from screen to plate with a new restaurant in Dubai. Its a world first, and Euronews Jane Witherspoon went to check it out. Shaun O’Neale was champion of MasterChef US Season 7 . He says the contest was one of the most stressful and hardest things hes ever done. "Youve got Gordon Ramsay screaming down your throat if youre not doing something right. But, it was the most rewarding thing, the most fulfilling thing. It really showed me my true passion and my true love for food. So its about time for people to come in and experience and get a taste of that mystery box." Now Sean and other MasterChef champions will be in residency at the MasterChef TV Experience - where they will also compose their own personal menus. Running the show In charge of the kitchen, the restaurants Head Chef, Margarita Vaamonde-Beggs. She says the MasterChef brand is a perfect fit for a restaurant - and for Dubai. "I believe that we stand out for us because we have already a huge fan base. In the Dubai market, it’s a city of foodies and it means something to so many people around the world." The Mystery Box One highlight on the menu is based on the shows Mystery Box challenge. Guests choose secret ingredients from the box and chefs have 35 minutes to create an original dish. And thats the dish Euronews wants. Today the Mystery Box ingredients include black garlic, Jerusalem artichokes, fresh oregano and a variety of mushrooms. They look delicious but will barely more than half-an-hour be enough time to turn them into a meal? Chef Margarita isnt worried: "We are going to be on time. Its going to be fine." It gets down to wire but 35 minutes later, with not a second to spare, Chef Margarita has produced a mouth-watering stuffed raviolo, covered with chocolate and black garlic. Not only does it taste amazing,

programme.title: Wildest Places S02 E03 - Connected Continents
programme.desc: Antarctica was once the centre of the ancient southern supercontinent, Gondwana. Traces of these connections remain throughout the southern hemisphere today: in plants and marine species with similarities that have long-ago changed and adapted to the environment around them.

programme.title: Wildest Places S02 E04 - Icy Islands

programme.title: Wildest Places S03 E01 - Outback Deserts
programme.desc: Australia’s vast interior is dry: nearly a fifth is classified as desert. With little rainfall and temperatures soaring above 50 degrees Celsius, it’s an unrelenting habitat. But these arid areas are also surprisingly varied, and can be breathtakingly spectacular.

programme.title: Wildest Places S03 E02 - Rainforests
programme.desc: Some of the world’s most ancient and ecologically diverse rainforests are in Australia: from the oldest tropical rainforest on earth, North Queensland’s Daintree, to the stunning central highlands of Tasmania in the far south.

programme.title: Winter Wonder, Sierra Mountains

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: S1:E2 Frank Shamrock was one of the toughest fighters to ever compete in the UFC. He holds the world record for the fastest consecutive knockouts, but his biggest fight happened when he was a child, living with his stepfather. His stepfather emotionally abused him so devastatingly, that even when Frank was sent to a Juvenile Detention Center, the other kids couldn’t believe what he went through. While many kids would be crushed under such pain and suffering, Frank Shamrock was determined to prove why warriors always find a way to win.

programme.title: Kim Kardashian & Pete Davidson Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E14 The whole world witnessed Kim and Kanyes marriage fall apart. At first it seemed like they were supporting each other through their divorce, but suddenly Kanye started to publicly attack Kim, accusing her of exploiting and kidnapping their children. What happened? Our team did some digging and traced it all back to Kims performance on SNL. Everyone assumes Kanye’s attacks are because of Pete Davidson, but we uncovered the real reason Kanye turned against Kim Kardashian.

programme.title: Justin Bieber Vs. Hailey Bieber
programme.desc: S2:E7 Justin and Hailey Bieber are at the height of their careers. So why do they keep getting sick? Our team uncovers this isn’t the first time one of Justin’s love interests has had a life-threatening illness. It all ties back to one question, did Justin cheat on Selena Gomez with Hailey?

programme.title: Ariana Grande vs. Pete Davidson
programme.desc: S1:E11 What made Kanye West go to war against Pete Davidson? Kanye is relentlessly going after Pete, so much so, that Kim Kardashian is concerned about the safety of her new boyfriend. Is it because Kanye knows Pete’s history of controversial relationships? Our team got the real story behind the tabloids, the truth behind Pete’s behavior in relationships, and the journey he went on to truly start loving who he is.

programme.title: Winona Ryder vs. Johnny Depp
programme.desc: S1: E10 Johnny Depp’s trial with Amber Heard had everyone talking, but wait until you hear about Winona Ryder’s. Johnny experienced love at first sight and became obsessed with Winona. But after their breakup, Winona dealt with mental health issues and her own very public trial, which has some striking similarities with Johnny and Ambers. Everyone thought she was a crazy, and the aftermath of her court case left her banished from the world. Winona went through a great awakening outside of the public eye and bounced back into Hollywood.

programme.title: Drake Vs. Kanye West
programme.desc: S1:E16 Drake went from hip hop hero to deadbeat dad when Kanye West collaborator Pusha T revealed Drake was hiding a secret son, but why was he hiding his son in the first place? And how did Pusha know about it?Everybody assumed Kanye had leaked the information because he was threatened by Drake’s success, but the truth is way more complicated.After digging into Drake and Kanye’s feud and friendship, our team discovered the real story behind Drake’s secret son and the journey he went on to embrace fatherhood for himself.

programme.title: Tupac Shakur: Fight For A Better World
programme.desc: Legendary hip hop artist Tupac Shakur left this world far too early, but it’s clear that he and his music had a lasting impact. Surrounded by violence and injustice Tupac fought for a better world.

programme.title: Oprah: Prison Of the Past
programme.desc: This one important person in Oprah Winfreys life wanted nothing to do with her until she was famous. Years later, Oprah is forced to confront her. Before you live a life of regret, listen to Oprah’s story

programme.title: Ultimate Freedom March: Remembering John Lewis
programme.desc: This short documentary is a tribute to the memory of civil rights leader John Lewis, his relationship with Martin Luther King Jr. and the courage he showed in fighting for an ideal, for freedom, democracy and justice. There is a moment in everyones life when our hearts are pounding and we are inspired and motivated to be the hero of our story. Step forward and go for what you believe in.

programme.title: Eva Mozes Kor: Surviving the Unthinkable
programme.desc: Eva Mozes Kor and her twin sister were tortured in Nazi Germany. She has held on to this secret for 40 years. And now, she finally tells her story.

programme.title: Muhammad Ali's Biggest Fight
programme.desc: Muhammad Ali, a man of conviction and great coherence. He was exactly who he said he was, a brilliant mind who never hesitated to put others first, a truly free man! A documentary made to inspire and motivate.

programme.title: GSP: Behind The Mask
programme.desc: As a child, Georges St-Pierre was bullied relentlessly by an older and much bigger boy at his school. He was tortured, and humiliated on a daily basis, leading to years of built up anger and frustration. It was this traumatizing childhood experience that led him to study martial arts and become one of the most celebrated UFC Champions in the world. Years later, Georges faced his childhood bully once again. What he chose to do in that moment is nothing short of amazing.

programme.title: Elizabeth Smart : Trapped and Lost
programme.desc: Elizabeth Smart was carried off at 14 years old and was missing for 9 grueling months. Those were the worst months of her life, the details of which were so terrible, she refused to share her story for ten years… until something changed. This is her story of survival and strength.

programme.title: Chanel Miller: Write Your Own Story
programme.desc: As the press called her Emily Doe & his legal team tried to frame her assailant Brock Turner as the "star athletes with everything to lose," Chanel Miller remained anonymous. What pushed her to break her silence during the final days of Turners trial? And how did her powerful statement about her sexual assault give a voice to survivors around the world?

programme.title: Wolf of Wallstreet's Darkest Hour
programme.desc: Visionary entrepreneur Jordan "The Wolf of Wall Street" Belfort explains how his own tale of redemption can help motivate you at your darkest hour.

programme.title: Win Against all Odds
programme.desc: Homesick, bankrupt, and father-less, young Dan Lok was devastated when he arrived home one day to find his mom in tears. His riveting coming-of-age story will inspire you to put your best foot forward every single day.

programme.title: Deshauna Barber: From Soldier to Miss USA
programme.desc: When Army officer-turned-beauty queen Deshauna Barber takes the stage, her path in life is almost unbelievable. She shares the secrets that haunted her for years in this exclusive Goalcast Original.

programme.title: Navigating Change
programme.desc: "Jeanniey Walden is joined by sesame Street for laughter and love talks, Lara Eurdolian for bulding your business and youve got to hear how Lynwood Bibbens, CEO of ReachTV stays ahead of the competition."

programme.title: Career Advice
programme.desc: Jeanniey Walden discusses how you can manage your career and stand out in your job search. Guests include Sanya Richards Ross and Bryan Baumler.

programme.title: Here's Why the 5 Years Before Retirement Are So Important
programme.desc: People often look past the last few years before retirement. But those years are crucial to the development of your successful retirement plan. James explains the reasons why these years are crucial to planning for your retirement both financially and personally.

programme.title: A Comprehensive Guide to Medicare Supplemental Plans: Top Choices and Key Differences
programme.desc: "This guide dives into the top three supplemental plans, their differences, and what to consider when making your decision."

programme.title: 5 Issues of the Inflation Reduction Act Affecting Your Medicare in 2024!
programme.desc: Medicare School comes to you with the latest updates from the Inflation Reduction Act and how they impact you in 2024? Marvin Musick from Medicare School breaks down the top 5 changes that you need to know about. From the zero-cost shingles vaccine under Medicare Part D to the $35 cap on insulin. Its all about making Medicare work for you! We understand that Medicare can be complex, but Marvin is here to make it simple. He brings clarity to the new income and resource criteria for the Extra Help program, ensuring you dont miss out on crucial benefits. Plus, were taking a closer look into the major overhaul of the Part D prescription drug plan phases this is big news for your budget! Theres also a HUGE shift allowing Medicare to negotiate drug prices a move that could save you big bucks on medications. Dont just take our word for it tune in and see how these changes can positively impact your life in 2024!

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: "A good mindset is everything! Jeanniey Walden helps you shift yours with Jamie Hess, founder of the Gratitudeology and delves into trauma bonds with Dr Nadine Macaluso of the real Wolf of Wall Street fame."

programme.title: Career Advice
programme.desc: Jeanniey Walden discusses how you can manage your career and stand out in your job search. Guests include Sanya Richards Ross and Bryan Baumler.

programme.title: The Earliest and Saefest Time to Stop Saving for Retirement
programme.desc: Investing for the future is a commendable and necessary goal for financial security, especially in retirement. However, there comes a point when continuing to save may have diminishing returns, sacrificing current experiences for a future that might be overly secured. In this blog post, well delve into a real client case study and explore the principles of compounding and opportunity cost that led to a surprising recommendation: to stop saving for retirement.

programme.title: PRISMA
programme.desc: Prisma es un programa cultural producido por CGTN en español en colaboración con el multimedio de comunicación latinoamericano teleSUR. Su objetivo es mostrar a los televidentes la riqueza cultural de China y el mundo hispanohablante, elevar el conocimiento de la cultura china en los países de habla hispana y establecer una plataforma de diálogo entre ambas partes. Se trata de un programa mensual de 30 minutos de duración que comenzó a emitirse en agosto de 2016. Está compuesto de tres segmentos que destacan por su diversidad temática. Primero, un espacio de noticias culturales; después, una semblanza de alguna personalidad del ámbito cultural latinoamericano; y finalmente un documental sobre aspectos de la cultura china.

programme.title: The Bay Of Fundy: A Kayaking Adventure In Nova Scotia
programme.desc: Humpback whales inches from your kayak or multiple beat downs at the Walton ‘Wopper’ – these are some of the contrasting experiences captured on camera in Nova Scotia’s Bay of Fundy. Join top sea kayakers taking on the world’s largest tidal range; carving it up in the chocolately rapids of the Shubie river and seeing how long they can hold their breath in the meaty hole at Walton. Local paddler Chris Lockyer hosts Justine Curgenven and a crew of international sea kayaking talent.

programme.title: Casper - Spooking About Africa (1957)
programme.desc: Casper is in an African jungle. He frightens a zebra at a watering hole. Wheezy the elephant has a terrible sneezing problem; he sneezes all the feathers off a peacock and a group of monkeys out of their perches. Casper decides to help, and in the process dislodges the feather that was making the elephant sneeze. But then a fire breaks out, and the elephant is unable to sneeze on command.

programme.title: Ice From Space

Soon the base commander, Major Dozier, is forced to deal not only with the bullheaded Congressman Burns, but the fact that the ice seems to be able to freeze everything around it.

programme.desc: After going renegade on a Foray, Kathleen an English woman goes down south to Ngara Town. Seeking redemption, Kathleen saves Ngara Town and becomes her new hero. But when Diwani (point man of the Foray) comes to Ngara to retrieve from Kathleen what belongs to the Foray, Kathleen must go against the odds to save Ngara from Diwani and a Foray striking for the very soul of Ngara Town.

programme.title: THREE DAYS OF HAMLET
programme.desc: A heros journey from the most unlikely of sources, a Shakespeare in Love for the reality set...What makes this first-person doc so unique is the heros personal narrative; an actor/manager, dealing with the ghost of his father, both real and imagined. Taking place over three days, they rehearse and perform a stage reading of Shakespeares classic -- in this day of mixed media and cultural attention deficit, a monumental task that is rendered gracefully. As the lives of the players juxtapose over their characters, what results is a fascinating look at how, once again, art illuminates life. By holding the mirror up to ourselves, we illuminate the world around us.

programme.desc: Deivamagal is an Indian Tamil-language soap opera starring Vani Bhojan and Krishna. Kumarans successful soap, Thirumathi Selvam, and replaced by Nayagi. The show is produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S. Kumaran. This serial was shot in Pollachi, Chennai, Chengalpet, Hyderabad, Kerala, Puducherry, and Cuddalore. programme.title: Tommys Got Talent
programme.desc: Charlie and the twins are practising for Mayor De Pfeffle’s talent contest. Deedee isn’t contesting as she didn’t get any time to practice. The twins have a tough time dancing in step with Uncle Charlie’s drum beat. Deedee tries to help them with a remembering spell, but Nino points out that it wouldn’t be fair to use magic in a contest. So Deedee and Nino walk along wishing the twins are able to perfect their act in time. Mewmew si struggling with a juggling act, so Deedee tries to help by conjuring a catching spell, but Nino reminds her it’s wrong just in time. Luciano haughtily sings as he walks. But Deedee and Nino hear an even more beautiful tune emanating from Tommy Prickles house. But Tommy is not too confident to sing in the presence of others. So Deedee comes up with a non-magic way to help. Happy at what Deedee suggests, Tommy decides to enroll. The fabulous prize is Tiggy’s very own specially made jelly. The winner is decided by who gets the highest ovation as measured on the clap-o-meter. Charlie and the twins perform outstandingly, so does Mewmew the juggling rabbit, Luciano’s opera all of whom get loud ovations. Finally it is Tommy prickles turn, but he isn’t able to keep his eyes closed like Deedee suggested him to, making his singing come to an abrupt stop. Deedee asks the audience if they could close their eyes to help Tommy sing. That was all Tommy needed to sing so very melodiously. The clap-o-meter does a full spin and points to the highest score ever. Tommy is declared the winner of Mayor De Pfeffle’s talent contest, that too without magic a wee bit.
